title: clockchart-construction
text: First need construct skeleton, clock event times plotted. , need circle, mark 24 dots denote 24 hours, starting 00:00 (12 ) 23:00 (11 PM). enough draw unit circle, although circle radius . R, easiest draw circle using complex equation. unit circle, equation eiθe^{\theta}, ee Euler’s number, irrational constant approximate value 2.71828; ii stands imaginary unit, equal −1\sqrt{-1}; θ\theta refers trigonometric angle radian. make complete circle, need allow θ\theta take values 0 360 degrees (2π2\pi radian). Programmatically, need create angles ranging 0 2π2\pi connect make complete circle. Let us create 100 angles use circle equation (eiθe^{\theta}). trigonometric form equation sin2θ+cos2θ=1sin^2 \theta + cos^2 \theta = 1, algebraic form x2+y2=1x^2+y^2 = 1. complex form, however, convenient. Unit Circle R just takes complex numbers plots values real part X axis corresponding values imaginary part Y axis. Now mark hours circle make look like clock. show 24 hours marks well marks minute marks, corresponding fraction hour. clock slightly different traditional clock 24 hours instead 12, also one hand, hour hand, minute part added hour mark fraction; second part, minor contribution, ignored. First, let us see output 24 hour marks.  time, move R package ggplot2 produce better graphics. need create R data frame plotting ggplots. also mark points minutes. First, let us create required data frame Explanation k = 24 indicates 24 hours. hour divided 4 parts , corresponding elapse successive 15 minutes. Thus, small point @ref(fig:clock24) middle two larger point (hour) means half hour elapsed. instance, point middle 7 PM 8 PM 7:30 PM. Now code exp(1i * 2 * pi * (k:1) / k) gives us angles corresponding 24 hours clock. , note angles trigonometry starts 0o0^o (X-axis) rotates counter-clockwise, direction opposite rotation clock hands (significance difference seen shortly). clock moves clockwise. 0 degree, 3 12-hour clock 6 24-hours clock. Similarly, code SubT = exp(1i * 2 * pi * (subk:1) / subk) gives us angles corresponding fraction hour. already mentioned, clock hand rotates clock-wise, starting 0o0^o angle, name labels 6 PM 11 PM, 12 PM 11 PM, followed 12 5 . code c(rep(" ",6), rep(" PM",12), rep(" ",6)) ensures sequence. place data two data frames subtimes dfclock, since unequal dimensions.  Next, plot lines using ggplot2 package. functions geom_path() job, geom_line() used fill gap first last point. aspect.ratio = 1 set ensure chart size depend resizing Rstudio Viewer size. points corresponding hours labelled PM using geom_text() function. need axis labels ticks. Let us remove :  completes first part plot; get skeleton clock. second final part task involves plotting event times appropriate points. Now, task several variations. simplest form, just chart, called clock_chart, plots event times 24-hour clock. optional argument Col can used change color clock hands. variations discussed later, complete discussion event times prepared plotting.
code: k <- 100 timepoint <- exp(1i * 2 * pi * (k:1) / k) plot(timepoint, pch = 19, type = "b") k <- 24 hour <- exp(1i * 2 * pi * (k:1) / k) plot(hour, pch = 19) k <- 24 # Hours subk <- 24*4 # Fraction of hours times <- exp(1i * 2 * pi * (k:1) / k) subtimes <- data.frame(SubT = exp(1i * 2 * pi * (subk:1) / subk))  ampm = c(rep(" AM",6), rep(" PM",12), rep(" AM",6)) library(tibble) dfclock <- tibble(time = times,                   hour = c(6:12, 1:12, 1:5), # May not be needed                   label = paste0(c(6:12, 1:5), ampm)) library(ggplot2) # Load the package ggplot2 p1 <- dfclock %>% ggplot()+   geom_path(data = subtimes, aes(Re(SubT), Im(SubT)))+   # Connect Last two missing points   geom_line(data = subtimes %>% dplyr::slice(-c(2:95)), aes(Re(SubT), Im(SubT)))+   theme(aspect.ratio = 1)+   geom_text(data = dfclock, aes(Re(time)*1.1, Im(time)*1.1, label = label))+   geom_point(data = subtimes,               aes(Re(SubT), Im(SubT)), shape = 19, color = "black", size = 0.6)+   geom_point(aes(Re(time), Im(time)), color = "black", size = 1.8) p1 p1 + theme(axis.text.x=element_blank(),          axis.ticks.x=element_blank(),          axis.text.y=element_blank(),           axis.ticks.y=element_blank())+   labs(x = "", y = "")

title: clockchart-construction
text: data format HH:MM:SS. need convert data (x,y) coordinates. unit circle, example, 12 plotted Y-axis (x = 0, y = 1) 6 X axis (x = 1, y = 0), although, avoid plotting circumference, decrease length little (later). convert HH:MM:SS coordinates unit circle, first separate parts time HH, MM, SS. accomplish using dplyr tidyr package. gives us hour, minute, second character (chr) vectors, need numeric vectors. conversion made .numeric function. challenge now combine hour minute one singe time, later convert coordinate. intentionally ignore second (SS), since negligible contribution plot. short algorithm used: Note 30 minutes equivalent half hour, 1:30:00 corresponds 1.5 hour. need recall time values range 0 60, decimal number system gives us suitable range 1 100. number system, reaching 100 indicates completed work, clockworks say reaching 60 completes one cycle task. hour part need conversion. 23 23 22 22. Thus, 15 minutes clock says 1560=14\frac{15}{60} = \frac14 th 25%25\% work, 30 means 3060=12=0.5\frac{30}{60} = \frac12 = 0.5 50%50\% work, 50 means 5060\frac{50}{60} 83%83\% work completed. task complicated due clock angles rotating opposite directions. ////CONVERSION BUG//// ifelse(.dataminute<10,.dataminute<10, .dataminute * 5/30, .data$minute * 5/300) ////MAY DEPEND OLD TIME FORMAT HHMM hrs/////
code: # Data to check on chkdf <- data.frame(time = c("06:00:00", "12:00:00", "17:30:00", "00:05:25"),                     value = sample(10,4)) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union chkdf %>% tidyr::separate_wider_delim(cols = time,                           names = c("hour", "minute", "second"),                           cols_remove = FALSE,                          delim = ":") #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>   hour  minute second time     value #>   <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>    <int> #> 1 06    00     00     06:00:00     7 #> 2 12    00     00     12:00:00     5 #> 3 17    30     00     17:30:00     6 #> 4 00    05     25     00:05:25    10

title: clockplot
text: installing package, load use available functions.
code: library(clockplot)

title: clockplot
text: clockpolot offers three types plot Clock charts Cyclic Charts Period planner first type shows event times 24 hour clock. times can arbitrary formats HH:MM:SS, HH:MM even H:M (as9:3`) necessarily specific hours . second type allows show values certain duration (day, week, month, year). generic function cyclic_chart() arbitrary period, charts specially made specific period (day, week, year etc.) Finally, third one can help make plan certain period (day, week, month, year), presenting tasks period.

title: clockplot
text: examples use built-data sets. allowed time formats family charts HH:MM:SS, HH:MM even H:M (12;30:09 9:3).

title: clockplot
text: simplest clock chart; hands neither colored length modified criteria. going use smsclock data set. Let us look . necessary code produce chart just : code produces ggplot2 object, can add (+) add extra components make informative.
code: head(smsclock) #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   Date       day       time     sender invoked type  Title      #>   <chr>      <chr>     <chr>    <chr>  <chr>   <chr> <chr>      #> 1 01-09-2024 Sunday    14:29:00 Airtel No      offer AirtelTune #> 2 01-09-2024 Sunday    20:28:00 Airtel No      offer AirtelTune #> 3 02-09-2024 Monday    10:43:00 Airtel No      offer AirtelTune #> 4 03-09-2024 Tuesday   13:15:00 Airtel No      offer AirtelTune #> 5 04-09-2024 Wednesday 12:24:00 Airtel No      offer AirtelTune #> 6 04-09-2024 Wednesday 17:45:00 Airtel No      offer AirtelTune clock_chart(smsclock, time, Col = "green") p1 <- clock_chart(smsclock, time, Col = "green") p1 + ggplot2::labs(title = "SMS Receiving Times")

title: clockplot
text: previous chart, colored hands arbitrary color. may want color numeric variable. clock_chart_col() exactly . may use bdquake data set . code without added components. Let us modify .  great modify length hands well. see next chart.
code: head(bdquake) #>   latitude longitude  depth mag      hms #> 1  24.3726   92.6936 35.000 4.4 21:12:27 #> 2  25.7318   91.0047 41.021 4.1 02:20:09 #> 3  21.9812   92.6510 44.892 4.1 16:46:37 #> 4  25.7414   90.2866 10.000 4.4 08:57:52 #> 5  25.2901   91.7860 46.386 4.2 03:16:57 #> 6  23.1475   90.9317 45.057 5.5 03:35:33 clock_chart_col(bdquake, time = hms, crit = mag) p <- clock_chart_col(bdquake, time = hms, crit = mag) p + ggplot2::labs(size = "Magnitude", title = "Earthquakes in Bangladesh since 2023")

what: Chart with Modified and Colored Hands
title: clockplot
text: now use clock_chart_qnt(). color chart magnitude change length depth earthquake hypocenter. high low color names can vice versa colors, depending context. use single color lines, use value high low custom plot  two variables len Col, use one single variable options. evident chart, size points represents magnitude earthquakes, color length hands stand depth earthquakes. plot shows quakes roughly randomly distributed respect time. earthquakes occurred around 1 PM around 5 PM. Two biggest gaps can seen 5 PM 9 PM (gap amounting 4 hours) 10 PM quarter 2 (almost 4.25 hours).
code: clock_chart_qnt(data = bdquake, time = hms, len = depth, Col = mag, high = "red", low = "blue") p1 <- clock_chart_qnt(data = bdquake, time = hms, len = depth, Col = mag, high = "red", low = "blue") p1 + ggplot2::labs(color = "Depth", size = "Magnitude", title = "Earthquakes in Bangladesh since 2023")

title: clockplot
text: Although another function clock_chart_len() modify length clock hands, rarely useful. can use variable modify length argument Col choose specific color hands.
code: p1 <- clock_chart_len(data = bdquake, time = hms, crit = depth) p1 + ggplot2::labs(title = "Earthquakes in Bangladesh since 2023")

title: clockplot
text: column represents length, distance, amount, something similar, may go ahead use clock_chart_qnt, otherwise, length meaningfully present variable, can confine clock_chart_qnt().

title: clockplot
text: makes convenient see types messages sent . Certain types messages, Supper_Offer, always sent around time. messages spread throughout day. 11 PM 6 , messages received. can also make use facet_wrap() function ggplot2 package. Instructions beginning args use labs.
code: clock_chart_qlt(smsclock, time = time, crit = Title)+ ggplot2::labs(color = "Sender", title = "SMS's Received throughout the Day")

code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("mahmudstat/clockplot")

text: Click see available functions.

title: Clock Chart with Event Times on Clock
text: mention relevant applications. Click see reproducible codes. small data times messages received throughout particular day, along sender messages types. Let us pattern messages senders.
code: #> Warning in clock_chart_qlt(smsclock, time = time, crit = sender): No. of #> categories is more than 5 and may not be distinguished well. Try clock_chart() #> function instead?

title: Clock Chart with Event Times on Clock
text: charts produce ggplot objects, can make use many functions ggplot2 package. can use labs function, example, add title, subtitle, caption etc. examples shown next segment. can also add legend change position using code theme(legend.position = "right"); accepted positions top, bottom, left, right.

what: The Simplest Clock Chart, Lines Unmodified — clock_chart
title: The Simplest Clock Chart, Lines Unmodified — clock_chart
text: five types clock charts, clock_chart() simplest one. just shows event times 24 hour clock. lines neither colored, length modified. clock_chart_col() used colorize clock_chart_len() change length hands numeric vector. simultaneously, use clock_chart_qnt(). use qualitative variable criterion, use clock_chart_qlt().

title: The Simplest Clock Chart, Lines Unmodified — clock_chart
code: clock_chart(data, time, Col = "black")

title: The Simplest Clock Chart, Lines Unmodified — clock_chart
text: data data frame time Time 24 hours. allowed time formats family charts HH:MM:SS, HH:MM even H:M (12;30:09 9:3), although SS part ignored due negligible impact final plot). Col Color name lines. default black.

title: The Simplest Clock Chart, Lines Unmodified — clock_chart
text: Change title, subtitle caption plot ggplot2::labs().

title: The Simplest Clock Chart, Lines Unmodified — clock_chart
code: p1 <- clock_chart(smsclock, time) # Using package built-in data p1 + ggplot2::labs(title = "SMS Receiving Times")  #  Add clock_chart(brintcity %>% filter(Origin == "Dhaka"), time = Departure)

what: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Numeric Variable — clock_chart_col
title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Numeric Variable — clock_chart_col
text: function plot time events 24 hour clock show events took place times. lines colored criteria.

title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Numeric Variable — clock_chart_col
code: clock_chart_col(data, time, crit, high = "red", low = "green")

title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Numeric Variable — clock_chart_col
text: data data frame time Time 24 hours. allowed time formats family charts HH:MM:SS, HH:MM even H:M (12;30:09 9:3). crit numeric vector lines colored. high color name high values. default red low color name high values. default green. color names can vice versa colors, depending context.

title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Numeric Variable — clock_chart_col
text: Change title, subtitle caption plot ggplot2::labs() .Change legend title adding ggplot2::labs(size = "TITLE") labs(color = "TITLE"). Add modify legend theme(legend.position = "POSITION"); valid postion names ggplot2 top, bottom, right, left, excluding complex options.

title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Numeric Variable — clock_chart_col
code: df <- data.frame(time = c("06:00:00", "08:00:00", "17:30:00"), value = c(3,6,9)) clock_chart_col(df, time, crit = value)+ ggplot2::labs(size = "TITLE")

what: Clock Chart with Modified Length — clock_chart_len
title: Clock Chart with Modified Length — clock_chart_len
text: function plot time events 24 hour clock show events took place times. length hands modified according numeric vector. color name can used hands. better use color length together, consider using clock_chart_qnt().

title: Clock Chart with Modified Length — clock_chart_len
code: clock_chart_len(data, time, crit, Col = "black")

title: Clock Chart with Modified Length — clock_chart_len
text: data data frame time Time 24 hours. allowed time formats family charts HH:MM:SS, HH:MM even H:M (12;30:09 9:3). crit numeric vector length hands modified. Col optional color name hands, defaulted black.

title: Clock Chart with Modified Length — clock_chart_len
text: Change title, subtitle caption plot ggplot2::labs(). See examples.

title: Clock Chart with Modified Length — clock_chart_len
code: p1 <- clock_chart_len(data = bdquake, time = hms, crit = depth) p1 + ggplot2::labs(title = "Earthquakes in Bangladesh since 2023")

what: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Factor — clock_chart_qlt
title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Factor — clock_chart_qlt
text: function plot time events 24 hour clock show events took place times. hands colored qualitative (factor) vector.

title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Factor — clock_chart_qlt
code: clock_chart_qlt(data, time, crit)

title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Factor — clock_chart_qlt
text: data data frame time Time 24 hours. allowed time formats family charts HH:MM:SS, HH:MM even H:M (12;30:09 9:3). crit qualitative vector hands colored.

title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Factor — clock_chart_qlt
text: Change title, subtitle caption plot ggplot2::labs(). Change legend title adding ggplot2::labs(color = "TITLE"). Add modify legend theme(legend.position = "POSITION"); valid postion names ggplot2 top, bottom, right, left, excluding complex options.

title: Clock Chart, Hands Colored by a Factor — clock_chart_qlt
code: # A plot showing sms receiving times based on # criteria (type/sender/invoked) clock_chart_qlt(smsclock, time = time, crit = sender)+ ggplot2::labs(color = "Sender", title = "SMS's Received throughout th Day")

what: Clock Chart, Length and Color Modified by Numeric Variables — clock_chart_qnt
title: Clock Chart, Length and Color Modified by Numeric Variables — clock_chart_qnt
text: function plot time events 24 hour clock show events took place times. length color hands modified according numeric vector.

title: Clock Chart, Length and Color Modified by Numeric Variables — clock_chart_qnt
code: clock_chart_qnt(data, time, len, Col, high = "red", low = "green")

title: Clock Chart, Length and Color Modified by Numeric Variables — clock_chart_qnt
text: data data frame time Time 24 hours. allowed time formats family charts HH:MM:SS, HH:MM even H:M (12;30:09 9:3). len numeric vector hands modified colored. Col color line segments points. high color name high values. default red low color name high values. default green. color names can vice versa colors, depending context. use single color lines, use value high low

title: Clock Chart, Length and Color Modified by Numeric Variables — clock_chart_qnt
text: Change title, subtitle caption plot ggplot2::labs() .Change legend title adding ggplot2::labs(color = "TITLE 1", size = "TITLE2"). Add modify legend theme(legend.position = "POSITION"); valid postion names ggplot2 top, bottom, right, left, excluding complex options.

title: Clock Chart, Length and Color Modified by Numeric Variables — clock_chart_qnt
code: p1 <- clock_chart_qnt(data = bdquake, time = hms, len = depth, Col = mag, high = "red", low = "blue") p1 + ggplot2::labs(color = "Depth", size = "Magnitude", title = "Earthquakes in Bangladesh since 2023")

title: Clyclic Chart — cyclic_chart
text: function plots values corresponding random periods hours, days, months .

title: Clyclic Chart — cyclic_chart
code: cyclic_chart(df, Period, Value, crit, ColV)

title: Clyclic Chart — cyclic_chart
text: df data frame Period list periodical values hours day, days week, months year . Value numeric vector values corresponding Period crit factor variable based bars colored. ColV character vector list colors bars. can use online tool (https://r-charts.com/color-palette-generator/) create beautiful color palette.

title: Clyclic Chart — cyclic_chart
text: circular chart showing values month year.

title: Clyclic Chart — cyclic_chart
text: can plot values corresponding multiple categories, example, temperature different cities days week, rainfall month year.

title: Clyclic Chart — cyclic_chart
code: # Using package built-in bdtemp data Col <- c("#0040ff", "#00bfff", "#8000ff") cyclic_chart(bdtemp, Period = Month, Value = Temperature, crit = City, ColV = Col)

clockplot (development version)
text: User give time HH:MM:SS; HH:MM even H:M also allowed. Fixed bug containing hour, minute, second variable internal data conversion. Updated smsclock data (Sep 01 Sep 09 (2024)) Added gitcommit data 12 Sep, 2024

title: clockplot 0.6.1.9000
text: Started testing using usethis::use_testthat(3) Added Bangladesh Railway data set (brintcity) conv_hms deprecated. Use hms::parse_hm() instead. Added legend size geom_point() Added explained clock_chart() examples vignettes.

title: clockplot 0.5.1.9000
text: Added gray lines along hour hands Removed grid lines clock skeleton Converted length variable 0.5-1 range
